neighbors.name: Justin Wykowski
neighbors.claims: Justin Wykowski owns a parcel in rural Baltimore County but has no record of public civic roles or statements ([bcps.new.swagit.com](https://bcps.new.swagit.com/videos/264249#:~:text=Jul%2011%2C%202023%20Board%20of,ON%20THE)). Searches of local news and county records did not surface any references to Wykowski’s involvement in community or development issues ([bcps.new.swagit.com](https://bcps.new.swagit.com/videos/264249#:~:text=Jul%2011%2C%202023%20Board%20of,ON%20THE)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted farm community leader assure him the land can retain agricultural value despite the project ([marylandmatters.org](https://marylandmatters.org/2025/08/05/maryland-solar-law-reca-farmers/#:~:text=cannot%20withstand,around%20feeding%20the%20poultry%20industry)), and propose landscape buffers to prevent the feeling of being encircled by solar panels ([www.wypr.org](https://www.wypr.org/wypr-news/2025-03-11/baltimore-county-residents-fight-solar-farm-landowner-says-property-rights-at-stake#:~:text=Kalindi%20Hooper%2C%20who%20lives%20in,facilities%20are%20already%20close%20by)).

neighbors.name: Jerome G. Morsberger
neighbors.claims: Jerome G. Morsberger is part of a local family known for property development and business in Baltimore County ([msa.maryland.gov](https://msa.maryland.gov/megafile/msa/speccol/sc3500/sc3520/013300/013346/html/sun2-18-2001.html#:~:text=He%20served%20in%20the%20Army,Korean%20War%2C%20stationed%20in%20Panama)). His family’s legacy includes decades of civic involvement – for instance, a relative was a state legislator remembered as “loyal to the community” ([msa.maryland.gov](https://msa.maryland.gov/megafile/msa/speccol/sc3500/sc3520/013300/013346/html/sun2-18-2001.html#:~:text=Annapolis%20during%20the%20session%2C%20he,was%20loyal%20to%20the%20community)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Morsberger via a peer from the local farm bureau or a community figure he respects, highlighting that not all farmland will be lost to solar ([marylandmatters.org](https://marylandmatters.org/2025/08/05/maryland-solar-law-reca-farmers/#:~:text=cannot%20withstand,around%20feeding%20the%20poultry%20industry)) ([marylandmatters.org](https://marylandmatters.org/2025/08/05/maryland-solar-law-reca-farmers/#:~:text=If%20you%20ask%20the%20solar,industry%2C%20farmers%E2%80%99%20fears%20are%20unfounded)). Emphasize commitments to maintain the area’s rural character with visual screening and site design sensitivity ([www.wypr.org](https://www.wypr.org/wypr-news/2025-03-11/baltimore-county-residents-fight-solar-farm-landowner-says-property-rights-at-stake#:~:text=Kalindi%20Hooper%2C%20who%20lives%20in,facilities%20are%20already%20close%20by)).

neighbors.name: Warren Taylor
neighbors.claims: Warren Taylor owns property in Baltimore County (PIN 2500014277) but has not been identified in any public-facing roles or news reports ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/legacyremembers/warren-taylor-obituary?id=11016078#:~:text=Warren%20Taylor%20Obituary%20%281942%20,Obituary%20Published%20by%20Legacy%20Remembers)). The only notable mention of a similar name in Maryland was an obituary of a different individual, underscoring the lack of public information on this landowner ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/legacyremembers/warren-taylor-obituary?id=11016078#:~:text=Warren%20Taylor%20Obituary%20%281942%20,Obituary%20Published%20by%20Legacy%20Remembers)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a neighboring farmer or agricultural extension agent talk with Mr. Taylor about preserving the farming legacy of the land alongside solar use ([marylandmatters.org](https://marylandmatters.org/2025/08/05/maryland-solar-law-reca-farmers/#:~:text=cannot%20withstand,around%20feeding%20the%20poultry%20industry)). Show visual mitigation plans (trees/fencing) to address concerns about the view and privacy near his property ([www.wypr.org](https://www.wypr.org/wypr-news/2025-03-11/baltimore-county-residents-fight-solar-farm-landowner-says-property-rights-at-stake#:~:text=Kalindi%20Hooper%2C%20who%20lives%20in,facilities%20are%20already%20close%20by)).

overview_summary: All three neighbors appear opposed to the proposed development (3 oppose, 0 support). Two have minimal public profiles and low community influence, while one hails from a prominent local family and wields moderate influence through established business and political ties.
